AccountDataDialogInput.description: Retrieve the dialog for confirming account data access request
AccountDataDialogInput.name: CONFIRM

AccountDataDialogInput.description: Retrieve the dialog for requesting account data access
AccountDataDialogInput.name: REQUEST

AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their birth date
ASC: Earliest dates to Highest dates (Oldest - Youngest)
AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.name: BIRTH_DATE

AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their death date
ASC: Earliest dates to last dates (Died First - Died Last)
AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.name: DEATH_DATE

AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their starMeterCurrentWeekRank
ASC: Lower popularity score means that the name is more popular, so the most popular names will be first
AdvancedNameSearchSortBy.name: POPULARITY

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Gross revenue pulled in via box-office in Domestic market for entire lifetime of title.
Domestic refers to North America (U.S., Canada, and Puerto Rico)
ASC: Lower numbers means the title has pulled in less box-office revenue, so poorer performing titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: BOX_OFFICE_GROSS_DOMESTIC

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Overall Metascore based on critic reviews. Titles without a metascore are
placed at the end when using ASC sort order.
ASC: Lower Metacritic score means the title is rated more poorly, so titles with worse scores will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: METACRITIC_SCORE

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Star Rating given by the requesting user.
ASC: Lower star rating means the title the user rated the title more poorly, so most disliked titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: MY_RATING

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Date when customer rated a title.
ASC: Earlier (older) ratings will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: MY_RATING_DATE

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
TitleMeterType.TITLE_METER (aka Pro MOVIEMeter). Score given to non-episodic title types.
ASC: Lower popularity score means that the title is more popular, so the most popular titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: POPULARITY

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Sort results based on specified ranking algorithm.  For the advancedTitleSearch query, exactly one ranked title list
constraint must be specified for using this sort option.
ASC: Higher ranks will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: RANKING

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Earliest wide release date of a title. Titles without a release date are
placed at the end when using ASC sort order.
ASC: Earlier (older) released title will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: RELEASE_DATE

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
The length of the title in terms of runtime.
ASC: Lower runtime means the title is shorter, so shortest titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: RUNTIME

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Star Rating given by the specified user in the SpecifiedUserRatingSearchConstraint.
Throws BAD_USER_INPUT if the SpecifiedUserRatingSearchConstraint is not specified.
ASC: Lower star rating means the title the user rated the title more poorly, so most disliked titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: SINGLE_USER_RATING

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Date when the specified user rated a title.
Throws BAD_USER_INPUT if the SpecifiedUserRatingSearchConstraint is not specified.
ASC: Earlier (older) ratings will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: SINGLE_USER_RATING_DATE

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Alphabetical sorting based on regional title text as determined by user language preferences.
Language preference is determined by x-imdb-user-country and x-imdb-user-language headers.
Only supports the languages/regions we support for localized search. Defaults to original title otherwise.
ASC: Lower numbers and letters near the top of the alphabet will be returned first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: TITLE_REGIONAL

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Weighted IMDb Star Rating as determined by users
Note: IMDb maintains a threshold to a minimum number of ratings before it is considered.
ASC: Lower star rating means the title is rated more poorly, so titles with worse ratings will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: USER_RATING

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
Count of ratings given by users
Note: IMDb maintains a threshold to a minimum number of ratings before it is considered.
ASC: Lower count of ratings means the title has been rated a fewer number of
times, so titles with least ratings will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: USER_RATING_COUNT

AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.description:
The recognized year of the title. Typically, the release year, but guidelines are here:
https://help.imdb.com/article/contribution/titles/title-formatting/G56U5ERK7YY47CQB
ASC: Earlier (older) titles will be first.
AdvancedTitleSearchSortBy.name: YEAR

AkaFilter.description: Filter the AKAs to a list of 1 AKA per region and language
AkaFilter.name: DISPLAY_TITLES_ONLY

AkaFilter.description: Exclude the aka if it's the same as the primary title text
AkaFilter.name: EXCLUDE_IF_SAME_AS_PRIMARY

AuthProviderType.description: For Amazon login with email gating association handle
AuthProviderType.name: AMAZON_EMAIL_GATING

AwardNominationsSortBy.description: Sorts by prestigious awards first, then reverse chronological by year
AwardNominationsSortBy.name: PRESTIGIOUS

BoxOfficeArea.description: Domestic refers to gross box-office revenue from North America (U.S., Canada, and Puerto Rico)
BoxOfficeArea.name: DOMESTIC

BoxOfficeArea.description: International covers the entire world excluding Domestic
BoxOfficeArea.name: INTERNATIONAL

ClaimedNameStatus.description: Customer's name claiming is blocked (usually by customer service admins)
ClaimedNameStatus.name: BLOCKED

ClaimedNameStatus.description: Customer has not requested to claim a name
ClaimedNameStatus.name: NOT_REQUESTED

ClaimedNameStatus.description: Customer's name claiming is pending manual approval
ClaimedNameStatus.name: PENDING_APPROVAL

ClaimedNameStatus.description: The new name page requested by customer is being created
ClaimedNameStatus.name: PENDING_CREATION

ClaimedNameStatus.description: Customer had claimed the name page before but not anymore
ClaimedNameStatus.name: PREVIOUS_CLAIMED

ClaimedNameStatus.description: Customer's name claiming is in an unknown status
ClaimedNameStatus.name: UNKNOWN

ClientSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their starMeterCurrentWeekRank

ASC: Lower popularity score means that the name is more popular,
so the most popular names will be first
ClientSortBy.name: POPULARITY

ComingSoonType.description: Series/miniseries with upcoming episodes and made-for-TV movies
ComingSoonType.name: TV

CompanyKnownForStatus.description: Indicates that the known for is active and can be modified
CompanyKnownForStatus.name: ACTIVE

CompanyKnownForStatus.description: Indicates that the known for is blocked from modification
CompanyKnownForStatus.name: BLOCKED

ConsentOperation.description: Customized consent, can be returned by Queries but not used as Mutation input.
ConsentOperation.name: CUSTOM

ConsentOperation.description:
Opt in to the consent. i.e. Yes or 'accept all'
Note: Default consent operation for a given type
is provided in the consentRequirement
ConsentOperation.name: IN

ConsentOperation.description:
Opt out of the consent. i.e. No or 'reject all'
Note: Default consent operation for a given type
is provided in the consentRequirement
ConsentOperation.name: OUT

ConsentType.description:
Consent for not sharing customer information with third parties.
For IMDb, this disables cross contextual behavioral advertising.
ConsentType.name: THIRD_PARTY_DATA_SHARING

ConsentType.description:
Used for Cookie/Tracker consent. Corresponds to "CookieConsent"
model in TollhouseService. https://tiny.amazon.com/1hii9awk1/codeamazpackPRIVblobb59emode
ConsentType.name: TRACKING_COOKIE

ContributorRankSortBy.description: Sort contributors by delta in their number of approved items from the previous period
ContributorRankSortBy.name: APPROVED_ITEMS_DELTA

ContributorRankSortBy.description: Sort contributors by approved contribution item count (i.e number of items accepted into the IMDb catalog)
ContributorRankSortBy.name: RANK

ContributorRankSortBy.description: Sort contributors by delta in their rank from the previous period
ContributorRankSortBy.name: RANK_DELTA

CreditCategoryTrait.description:
Identifies categories where the person appears as themselves in a on-screen
capacity. Specifically, their Self role is not captured in a more specific
category like Host or Judge.
CreditCategoryTrait.name: ADDITIONAL_APPEARANCES_TRAIT

CreditCategoryTrait.description: Identifies categories that make up the 'Cast' of a title
CreditCategoryTrait.name: CAST_TRAIT

CreditCategoryTrait.description: Identifies categories that make up the 'Crew' of a title
CreditCategoryTrait.name: CREW_TRAIT

CreditCategoryTrait.description:
Identifies categories for crew typically responsible for the creative shape of
a feature movie. Not exhaustive, intended as a summary of credits only.
CreditCategoryTrait.name: MAJOR_CREATIVE_INPUT_TRAIT

CreditCategoryTrait.description:
Identifies categories that are a catch-all of credits that do not belong in
the taxonomy of other categories. Allows clients to put less emphasis on the
category as a signifier of the work done by a name on a title.
CreditCategoryTrait.name: UNCATEGORIZED_TRAIT

CreditCategoryTrait.description:
Identifies categories that are still in testing phase and should be hidden
from public-facing interfaces such as search filters, dropdowns, and selection
controls. The presence of this trait indicates the category exists in the
system but is not yet ready for general availability in user experiences.
CreditCategoryTrait.name: UNDERGOING_TESTING_TRAIT

CreditsModePreset.description:
Credits are filtered to remove mention of passive roles, such as Thanks and Archive Footage.
Names are typically not known for roles where they were passively involved in the title.
CreditsModePreset.name: KNOWN_FOR

CreditsModePreset.description:
Applies the filters from "KNOWN_FOR". Additionally, contributed credits are
aggregated to the category level. If a name has performed several different Producer roles across episodes in a
TV series, these would be presented as a single CreditedRole within the CreditV2 response value for that title.
CreditsModePreset.name: KNOWN_FOR_WITH_CATEGORY_AGGREGATION

DeletionDialogInput.description: Retrieve the dialog for confirming deletion
DeletionDialogInput.name: CONFIRM

DeletionDialogInput.description: Retrieve the dialog for requesting deletion
DeletionDialogInput.name: REQUEST

EpisodeCreditsSortBy.description:
Episode ordering follows this priority sequence:
1. Release date
2. Series number
3. Episode number.
EpisodeCreditsSortBy.name: RELEASE_DATE

ExplicitContentFilter.description: Remove names that are flagged as adult from the results, this is the default
ExplicitContentFilter.name: EXCLUDE_ADULT

ExplicitContentFilter.description: Allow names that are flagged as adult to be included in results
ExplicitContentFilter.name: INCLUDE_ADULT

ExplicitContentFilter.description: Only allow names that are flagged as adult
ExplicitContentFilter.name: ONLY_ADULT

ExportStatusId.description: Indicates there's an existing export for the request and it has failed.
ExportStatusId.name: FAILED

ExportStatusId.description: Indicates there's an existing export for the request and it's in progress.
ExportStatusId.name: PROCESSING

ExportStatusId.description: Indicates there's an existing export for the request and it has finished successfully.
ExportStatusId.name: READY

ExportStatusId.description:
Indicates there's an existing export for the request and it has failed due to
the requester not having access to the requested resource.

This state is typically unexpected since users are generally expected to have
the necessary access to the list/ratings before requesting an export. However,
it can occur in unusual cases, such as when there is a change in list
permissions immediately before the export starts or if a user issues GraphQL
queries directly without proper access to the resource.
ExportStatusId.name: UNAUTHORIZED

FavoriteFilterOption.description: Don't include cinemas that a user has marked as a favorite.
FavoriteFilterOption.name: EXCLUDE_FAVORITES

FavoriteFilterOption.description: Only include cinemas that a user has marked as a favorite.
FavoriteFilterOption.name: ONLY_FAVORITES

FeaturedImagesOption.description: Return everything except featured images for this name.
FeaturedImagesOption.name: EXCLUDE_FEATURED

FeaturedImagesOption.description: Only return featured images for this name. There can be a maximum of 6.
FeaturedImagesOption.name: FEATURED_ONLY

FollowSortBy.description:
Sort entities based on their last updated time
DESC: Latest dates to earliest dates
FollowSortBy.name: LAST_UPDATED

GuildDataVerificationType.description: The data has been verified by the customer
GuildDataVerificationType.name: SELF_VERIFIED

GuildDataVerificationType.description: The data has been verified by a third party
GuildDataVerificationType.name: THIRD_PARTY_VERIFIED

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Convert an IMDb account that has existing LWA linkage to the authenticated Amazon account.
Client should call conversion mutation with just the Amazon token.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: CONVERT_LWA_TO_AAP

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Convert the authenticated IMDb account to the authenticated Amazon account.
Client should call conversion mutation with both tokens.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: CONVERT_TO_AAP

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Create new IMDb account using authenticated Amazon account.
Client should proceed with new account creation.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: CREATE_NEW_ACCOUNT

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Start IMDb account linking process.
Client should initiate the IMDb authentication flow for linking.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: LINK_IMDB_ACCOUNT

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Start IMDb account linking process.
Client should initiate the IMDb authentication flow for linking with a prefilled email.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: LINK_IMDB_ACCOUNT_EMAIL_PREFILLED

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Return user to sign-in options.
Client should navigate to the main sign-in options page/screen.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SHOW_SIGN_IN_OPTIONS

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Redirect user to Amazon (AAP) sign-in flow.
Client should navigate to the Sign in with Amazon page/screen.
Used for standard Amazon account authentication.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SIGN_IN_WITH_AMAZON

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Redirect user to IMDb sign-in flow.
Client should navigate to the Sign in with IMDb page/screen.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SIGN_IN_WITH_IMDB

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Redirect user to IMDb sign-in flow with a prefilled email.
Client should navigate to the Sign in with IMDb page/screen.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SIGN_IN_WITH_IMDB_EMAIL_PREFILLED

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Redirect user to LWA sign-in flow.
Client should navigate to the Sign in with Amazon page/screen.
Used for third-party applications (e.g., IMDb) requiring Amazon authentication.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SIGN_IN_WITH_LWA

InterstitialButtonAction.description:
Sign out the current user.
Client should clear authentication state and return to unauthenticated state.
InterstitialButtonAction.name: SIGN_OUT

InterstitialButtonStyle.description: Primary button - filled, emphasized style for main actions
InterstitialButtonStyle.name: PRIMARY

InterstitialButtonStyle.description: Secondary button - outlined style for alternative actions
InterstitialButtonStyle.name: SECONDARY

InterstitialButtonStyle.description: Text button - transparent style for alternative actions
InterstitialButtonStyle.name: TEXT

KeyStaffSortBy.description: Sort by StarMeter ranking (lower rank number = better rank)
KeyStaffSortBy.name: STARMETER

KnownForPreference.description: Known for calculated using an algorithm
KnownForPreference.name: AUTOMATIC

ListSearchSortBy.description:
Date when the list was created
ASC: Earlier date will be first.
ListSearchSortBy.name: DATE_CREATED

ListSearchSortBy.description:
Date when the list was last modified
ASC: Earlier date will be first.
ListSearchSortBy.name: DATE_MODIFIED

ListSearchSortBy.description:
List name, sort alphabetically
ASC: Aa-Zz
ListSearchSortBy.name: NAME

ManagedClientStatus.description: Client is not being managed by this manager but can request to be
ManagedClientStatus.name: CAN_REQUEST

ManagedClientStatus.description: Client is being managed by this manager
ManagedClientStatus.name: ENABLED

ManagedClientStatus.description: Client requested being managed by this manager
ManagedClientStatus.name: REQUESTED

ManagingRepresentativeStatus.description: Representative is not managing a client
ManagingRepresentativeStatus.name: DISABLED

MaturityLevel.description: Include content flagged as mature. Such content is excluded by default.
MaturityLevel.name: INCLUDE_MATURE

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have awards data
NameDataType.name: AWARD_NOMINATIONS

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have biography data
NameDataType.name: BIOGRAPHY

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have a birth date
NameDataType.name: BIRTH_DATE

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have a birth place
NameDataType.name: BIRTH_PLACE

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have a death date
NameDataType.name: DEATH_DATE

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have a death place
NameDataType.name: DEATH_PLACE

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have height data
NameDataType.name: HEIGHT_INFO

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have quotes data
NameDataType.name: QUOTES

NameDataType.description: Matches names that have trivia data
NameDataType.name: TRIVIA

NameGenderIdentity.description: Matches names whose gender is female
NameGenderIdentity.name: FEMALE

NameGenderIdentity.description: Matches names whose gender is male
NameGenderIdentity.name: MALE

NameGenderIdentity.description: Matches names whose gender is non_binary
NameGenderIdentity.name: NON_BINARY

NameGenderIdentity.description: Matches names whose gender is other
NameGenderIdentity.name: OTHER

NameListSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their birth date
ASC: Earliest dates to Highest dates (Oldest - Youngest)
NameListSearchSortBy.name: BIRTH_DATE

NameListSearchSortBy.description:
Date when the list item was added to the list
ASC: Earlier date will be first.
NameListSearchSortBy.name: DATE_ADDED

NameListSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their death date
ASC: Earliest dates to last dates (Died First - Died Last)
NameListSearchSortBy.name: DEATH_DATE

NameListSearchSortBy.description: List order determined by the customer
NameListSearchSortBy.name: LIST_ORDER

NameListSearchSortBy.description:
Sort names based on their starMeterCurrentWeekRank
ASC: Lower popularity score means that the name is more popular, so the most popular names will be first
NameListSearchSortBy.name: POPULARITY

NominationsSortBy.description: Sorts by prestigious awards first, then reverse chronological by year
NominationsSortBy.name: PRESTIGIOUS

NominationsSortBy.description: Sorts by wins first, then preserve default nomination order
NominationsSortBy.name: WINS

PollAdminAction.description: Admin created a new poll from a list.
PollAdminAction.name: CREATE

PollAdminAction.description: Admin synced an existing poll with the list.
PollAdminAction.name: SYNC

PollAnswerSortBy.description:
Sort answers by author defined index value.
ASC: From the least (1) to the greatest number.
PollAnswerSortBy.name: ANSWER_INDEX

PollAnswerSortBy.description:
Sort answers based on their vote count.
DESC: From greatest number to the least number. For same vote count, least ANSWER_INDEX first.
PollAnswerSortBy.name: VOTE_COUNT

PollSortBy.description:
Sort polls based on their create time.
DESC: From latest to earliest.
PollSortBy.name: CREATE_TIME

PromptType.description: Ratings prompt on title main page
PromptType.name: RATINGS_TITLE_MAIN

PromptType.description: Ratings prompt on title trivia sub-page
PromptType.name: RATINGS_TITLE_TRIVIA

RankedTitleListType.description: Popularity-based ranking that aggregates titles of type movie, short, and video.
RankedTitleListType.name: MOVIE_METER

RankedTitleListType.description: Popularity-based ranking that aggregates titles of all types aside from episodes (like podcast, tv, audio ...)
RankedTitleListType.name: TITLE_METER

RankedTitleListType.description: Popularity-based ranking that aggregates titles of type tv_series, tv_miniseries, tv_movie, tv_short, and tv_special
RankedTitleListType.name: TV_METER

RatingsPrivacySetting.description: Ratings are only public with attached review
RatingsPrivacySetting.name: PUBLIC_WITH_REVIEWS

RatingsSortBy.description:
Sort by most recent rating date.
ASC: Oldest ratings will be first.
DESC: Newest ratings will be first.
RatingsSortBy.name: MOST_RECENT

RatingsSortBy.description:
Sort by highest rating
ASC: Highest ratings will be first.
DESC: Lowest ratings will be first.
RatingsSortBy.name: TOP_RATED

ReactionsGroupSelectionType.description: Denotes there is no limit to the number of reactions from a group that may be selected
ReactionsGroupSelectionType.name: MULTIPLE

ReactionsGroupSelectionType.description: Denotes only one reaction from the group may be selected at a time
ReactionsGroupSelectionType.name: SINGLE

SavedSearchFilterType.description: Filter on tagged names in lists
SavedSearchFilterType.name: LIST_ITEM_NAME_TAGS

SavedSearchFilterType.description: Filter on tagged titles in lists
SavedSearchFilterType.name: LIST_ITEM_TITLE_TAGS

SearchWatchOptionType.description:
Match titles with any digital watch options including subscriptions and
rent/buy to stream online.
SearchWatchOptionType.name: ANY_DIGITAL

SearchWatchOptionType.description:
Match titles with a subscription-based streaming watch option
For example, watch options on Prime, Hulu, Netflix, etc. that can be streamed
with a subscription
SearchWatchOptionType.name: SUBSCRIPTION

SuggestionSearchMethodType.description: Weighted week + day ranking on the
SuggestionSearchMethodType.name: instant

TitleCinemaShowtimesFallbackOption.description: Fallback to the next available date of showtimes from the provided `filter.dateRange.startTime` input value, if the original result contains no showtimes.
TitleCinemaShowtimesFallbackOption.name: NEXT_AVAILABLE_DATE

The length of the title in terms of runtime.

Star Rating given by the specified user in the SpecifiedUserRatingSearchConstraint.

The recognized year of the title. Typically, the release year, but guidelines are here:
https://help.imdb.com/article/contribution/titles/title-formatting/G56U5ERK7YY47CQB
ASC: Earlier (older) titles will be first.

TitleMeterType.description: Ranking that aggregates titles of type movie, short, and video
TitleMeterType.name: MOVIE_METER

TitleMeterType.name: TITLE_METER

TitleMeterType.name: TV_METER

TitleReviewThemeSentiment.name: NEUTRAL

TopTrendingPredefinedEnum.name: INDIA_TITLE_TRENDS_RELEASED

UIWorkflowActionNavigationDirection.description: Moves the workflow backwards towards an earlier state

VideoMimeType.description:
A computer file format for a multimedia playlist. One common use of the M3U file format is
creating a single-entry playlist file pointing to a stream on the Internet - application/x-mpegurl
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M3U
VideoMimeType.name: M3U8

VideoMimeType.description:
The ISO standard video file format based on Quicktime - video/mp4
https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/video/mp4
VideoMimeType.name: MP4

VideoMimeType.description:
A video file format designed as a royalty-free alternative to use in HTML5 video - video/webm
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebM
VideoMimeType.name: WEBM

VideoPlacementType.description: Video ad that plays after the video content on the page.
VideoPlacementType.name: POSTROLL

VideoPlacementType.description: Video ad that plays prior to video content on the page.
VideoPlacementType.name: PREROLL

VideoRecommendationsDisplayType.description: PORTRAIT_ORIENTATION indicates the videos will all be shown in a portrait video player
VideoRecommendationsDisplayType.name: PORTRAIT_ORIENTATION
